intro: Alomia echioides, commonly known as the spiny alomia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Brazil and Argentina. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, spiny leaves, and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical environments, often in dry or semi-arid habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
